<HTML>
<HEAD>
     <TITLE>Exhibit 10.40</TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.40</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">THIRD AMENDMENT TO<BR><U>AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT</U></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Third Amendment to Amended and Restated Credit Agreement (the &#147;Third
Amendment&#148;) is made as of the 13th day of December, 2005 by and among</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">PATHMARK
STORES,  INC., a corporation  organized under the laws of the State of Delaware,  having
a place  of business at 200 Milik Street, Carteret, New Jersey 07008;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">the LENDERS
party hereto;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">FLEET
RETAIL  GROUP, LLC (f/k/a Fleet Retail Group, Inc.), as Administrative Agent and
Collateral Agent  for the Lenders, a Delaware limited liability company, having a place
of business at 40  Broad Street, Boston, Massachusetts 02109</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">THE CIT
GROUP/BUSINESS CREDIT, INC., as Syndication Agent; and</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">GMAC
COMMERCIAL FINANCE LLC and GENERAL ELECTRIC CAPITAL CORPORATION, as Co-Documentation
Agents</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">in consideration of the mutual
covenants herein contained and benefits to be derived herefrom.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>WITNESSETH</U></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS,
the Borrower, the Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent, the Lenders, the
Syndication Agent, and the Co-Documentation Agents have entered into an Amended
and Restated Credit Agreement dated as of October 1, 2004 (as amended and in
effect, the &#147;Credit Agreement&#148;); and</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS,
the Borrower, the Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent, the Lenders, the
Syndication Agent, and the Co-Documentation Agents have agreed to amend certain
provisions of the Credit Agreement as set forth herein.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">NOW
THEREFORE, it is hereby agreed as follows:</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">1. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Definitions</U>:
All  capitalized  terms used herein and not  otherwise  defined shall have the same
meaning  herein as in the Credit Agreement.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">2. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Amendments
to Article I</U>. The  provisions  of Article I of the  Credit  Agreement  are hereby
amended as  follows:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">a.
By  deleting  the  definition  of  &#147;Consolidated  EBITDA&#148; in  its  entirety
and  substituting the following in its stead:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Consolidated
EBITDA</U>&#148; means, for any period, Consolidated Net Income for such period,
<U>plus</U>, without duplication and to the extent deducted from revenues in determining
Consolidated Net Income, the sum of (a) the aggregate amount of Consolidated Interest
Expense for such period, (b) the aggregate amount of letter of credit fees paid during
such period, (c) provisions for taxes based on income for such period, (d) all amounts
attributable to depreciation and amortization for such period, (e) other non-cash items
(including charges for inventory accounted for on a last in, first out basis) reducing
Consolidated Net Income for such period (f) all Yucaipa Charges during such period, (g)
all extraordinary charges during such period, (h) all Strategic Charges during such
period, (i) all Project 2005 Expenses during such period, and (j) all expenses paid or
accrued through Fiscal Year 2006 for lease mitigation costs, shrink and other costs
incurred in connection with store closings reducing Consolidated Net Income for such
period, but in no event to exceed $22,000,000, and <U>minus</U>, without duplication and
to the extent increasing Consolidated Net Income for such period, (k) all extraordinary
gains during such period, (l) net gains (howsoever classified) from the sale of Real
Property Assets in excess of $10,000,000 during any four fiscal quarter period, and (m)
other non-cash items (other than pension income related to the Borrower&#146;s qualified
pension plan, to the extent such pension income constitutes a non-cash item) during such
period, all as determined on a consolidated basis with respect to the Borrower and its
consolidated Subsidiaries in accordance with GAAP.</FONT></P>

<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">b.
By deleting  the  definition  of  &quot;Employee  Stock  Option Plan&quot; in its
entirety and  substituting the following in its stead:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&#147;Employee
Stock Option Plan&#148; means,  collectively,  (a) the Pathmark Stores, Inc. 2000 Equity
Plan,  (b) the Pathmark Stores,  Inc. 2000 Non-Employee  Directors Equity Plan, and (c)
other arrangements  providing stock-based compensation exempt under Section 16b-3 of the
Exchange Act.</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">c.
By adding the following new definition in appropriate alphabetical order:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Project
2005 Expenses</U>&#148; means the sum of the following items, without duplication and to
the extent deducted from revenues in determining Consolidated Net Income for the Fiscal
Year ending on or about January 31, 2006 only: (a) expenses paid or accrued for the
remodeling of the Borrower&#146;s stores and charges to income made for inventory
shrinkage, all of which together shall not exceed an aggregate amount greater than
$13,500,000, <U>plus</U> (b) employee related expenses paid or accrued in connection with
(i) labor buyouts with respect to union associates, (ii) the termination of the employment
agreement of the former chief executive officer, and (iii) non-union employee
reorganization, all of which together shall not exceed an aggregate amount greater than
$11,700,000, in each case, as determined in accordance with GAAP.</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">3. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Conditions
to  Effectiveness</U>.  This Third  Amendment  shall not be effective  until each of the
following  conditions precedent have been fulfilled to the satisfaction of the Agent:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">a. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Third Amendment shall have been duly executed and delivered by the  Borrower, the
Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent and the Required  Lenders. The Administrative
Agent shall have received a fully executed copy  hereof and of each other document
required hereunder.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">b. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
Borrower shall have reimbursed the Administrative Agent for all expenses due  and payable
in connection herewith, including, without limitation, its  reasonable attorneys&#146; fees.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">c. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">No
Default or Event of Default shall have occurred and be continuing.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">d. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
Borrower shall have provided such additional instruments and documents to the
Administrative Agent as the Administrative Agent and its counsel may have  reasonably
requested.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">4. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Miscellaneous</U>.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">a. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">Except
as provided herein, all terms and conditions of the Credit Agreement and  the other Loan
Documents remain in full force and effect. The Borrower hereby  ratifies, confirms, and
reaffirms all of the representations, warranties and  covenants therein contained.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing,  the Borrower hereby acknowledges,
confirms and agrees that all Collateral shall  continue to secure the Obligations and any
modifications, amendments,  substitutions or renewals thereof.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">b. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Third Amendment may be executed in several counterparts and by each party  on a separate
counterpart, each of which when so executed and delivered, shall  be an original, and all
of which together shall constitute one instrument.  Delivery of an executed counterpart
of a signature page hereto by telecopy or  electronic transmission shall be effective as
delivery of a manually executed  counterpart hereof.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">c. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Third Amendment expresses the entire understanding of the parties with  respect to the
matters set forth herein and supersedes all prior discussions or  negotiations hereon.
Any determination that any provision of this Third  Amendment or any application hereof
is invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any  respect and in any instance shall not effect
the validity, legality, or  enforceability of such provision in any other instance, or
the validity,  legality or enforceability of any other provisions of this Third Amendment.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Third Amendment to be
executed and their seals to be hereto affixed as of the date first above
written.</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

<HEAD>
     <TITLE>Exhibit 10.41</TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.41</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>FOURTH AMENDMENT TO<BR><U>AMENDED AND RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT</U></B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Fourth Amendment to Amended and Restated Credit Agreement (the &#147;Fourth  Amendment&#148;)
is made as of the 24<SUP>th</SUP> day of March, 2006 by and  among</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">PATHMARK
STORES, INC., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Delaware, having a
place of business at 200 Milik Street, Carteret, New Jersey 07008;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">the LENDERS
party hereto;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">FLEET
RETAIL  GROUP, LLC (f/k/a Fleet Retail Group, Inc.), as Administrative Agent and
Collateral Agent  for the Lenders, a Delaware limited liability company, having a place
of business at 40  Broad Street, Boston, Massachusetts 02109</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">THE CIT
GROUP/BUSINESS CREDIT, INC., as Syndication Agent; and</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">GMAC
COMMERCIAL FINANCE LLC and GENERAL ELECTRIC CAPITAL CORPORATION, as Co-Documentation
Agents</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">in consideration of the mutual
covenants herein contained and benefits to be derived herefrom.</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B><U>WITNESSETH</U></B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS,
the Borrower, the Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent, the Lenders, the
Syndication Agent, and the Co-Documentation Agents have entered into an Amended
and Restated Credit Agreement dated as of October 1, 2004 (as amended and in
effect, the &#147;Credit Agreement&#148;); and</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS,
the Borrower, the Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent, the Lenders, the
Syndication Agent, and the Co-Documentation Agents have agreed to amend certain
provisions of the Credit Agreement as set forth herein.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">NOW
THEREFORE, it is hereby agreed as follows:</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">1. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Definitions</U>: All capitalized terms
used herein and not otherwise defined shall have the same meaning herein as in the Credit
Agreement.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Amendments to Article VI</U>. The
provisions of Article VI of the Credit Agreement are hereby amended by deleting the provisions of SECTION 6.17
in their entirety and substituting the following in their stead:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">6.17
<U>Ratio of Credit Extensions to Consolidated EBITDA</U>. The Borrower shall not, at any
time, permit the ratio of the Credit Extensions to Consolidated EBITDA (calculated on a
trailing four fiscal quarter basis) at the end of any fiscal quarter to be more than (i)
for the fourth fiscal quarter of Fiscal Year 2005 and each of the first three fiscal
quarters of Fiscal Year 2006, 2.40:1.00, and (ii) for each fiscal quarter thereafter,
1.90:1.00.</FONT></P>

<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Conditions to Effectiveness</U>. This Fourth Amendment shall not be effective
until each of the following conditions precedent have been fulfilled to the
satisfaction of the Agent:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">a. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Fourth Amendment shall have been duly executed and delivered by the  Borrower, the
Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent and the Required  Lenders. The Administrative
Agent shall have received a fully executed copy  hereof and of each other document
required hereunder.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">b. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
Borrower shall have reimbursed the Administrative Agent for all expenses due  and payable
in connection herewith, including, without limitation, its  reasonable attorneys&#146; fees.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">c. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
Borrower shall have paid to the Administrative Agent, for the account of the  Lenders, an
amendment fee as set forth in the amendment fee letter dated as of  even date herewith.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">d. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">No
Default or Event of Default shall have occurred and be continuing.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">e. </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
Borrower shall have provided such additional instruments and documents to the
Administrative Agent as the Administrative Agent and its counsel may have  reasonably
requested.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>Miscellaneous</U>.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">a.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">Except
as provided herein, all terms and conditions of the Credit Agreement and  the other Loan
Documents remain in full force and effect. The Borrower hereby  ratifies, confirms, and
reaffirms all of the representations, warranties and  covenants therein contained.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing,  the Borrower hereby acknowledges,
confirms and agrees that all Collateral shall  continue to secure the Obligations and any
modifications, amendments,  substitutions or renewals thereof.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">b.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Fourth Amendment may be executed in several counterparts and by each party  on a separate
counterpart, each of which when so executed and delivered, shall  be an original, and all
of which together shall constitute one instrument.  Delivery of an executed counterpart
of a signature page hereto by telecopy or  electronic transmission shall be effective as
delivery of a manually executed  counterpart hereof.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">c.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">This
Fourth Amendment expresses the entire understanding of the parties with  respect to the
matters set forth herein and supersedes all prior discussions or  negotiations hereon.
Any determination that any provision of this Fourth  Amendment or any application hereof
is invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any  respect and in any instance shall not effect
the validity, legality, or  enforceability of such provision in any other instance, or
the validity,  legality or enforceability of any other provisions of this Fourth
Amendment.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the
parties hereto have caused this Fourth Amendment to be executed and their seals
to be hereto affixed as of the date first above written.</FONT></P>

<table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.45
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>ex10-45.htm
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Exhibit 10.45</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY>

<Font size=2>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>Exhibit 10.45</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="5"><B>PATHMARK STORES, INC.</B></FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="5"><B>RETIREMENT INCENTIVE PROGRAM</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">&nbsp;</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=75%></TD>
<TD WIDTH=25% ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="3"><B>P<SMALL>ROGRAM</SMALL> O<SMALL>FFERING</SMALL><BR>D<SMALL>ECEMBER</SMALL> 9, 2005<BR><SMALL>TO</SMALL><BR>J<SMALL>ANUARY</SMALL> 23, 2006</B></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="3"><B>PATHMARK STORES, INC.</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="3"><B>RETIREMENT INCENTIVE PROGRAM</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">This booklet summarizes the key features of the Pathmark Stores, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;PSI&#148;) Retirement Incentive Program (referred to as the &#147;Program&#148; throughout this booklet). It is intended to amend your PSI Pension Plan (the &#147;Pension Plan&#148;) Summary Plan Description, as well as your PSI Medical Plan and Prescription Plan Summary Plan Descriptions, and should be considered a part of those Summary Plan Descriptions.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>If there are any differences between this booklet and the terms of the Pension Plan, Medical Plan, and Prescription Plan and their related documents, the terms of the specific plan and its related documents will govern.</B></FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="3"><B>PATHMARK STORES, INC.</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="3"><B>RETIREMENT INCENTIVE PROGRAM</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>I.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PURPOSE</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">This Program is intended to help accomplish the restructuring of the Company through voluntary retirements.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>II.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ELIGIBILITY</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">If you are an active (meaning not out on a Workers Compensation or any type of disability leave), full-time, non-union, non-store associate of Pathmark Stores, Inc., Plainbridge, Inc., or PTMK LLC on December 9, 2005, you may participate in the Retirement Incentive Program, provided you will:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>be at least age 52 (age 55, if a Vice President) by December 31, 2005;</FONT>
<BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>and</FONT>
<BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>have at least 10 years of continuous Pension Plan non-union Vesting Service since your most recent date of hire.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Program participation is not available to any otherwise eligible associate who is terminated for violation of Company policy, is receiving severance payments, or is not actively at work on January 23, 2006. In addition, participation in the Program is not available to associates of any company other than Pathmark Stores, Inc., Plainbridge, Inc., or PTMK LLC. Associates of other subsidiaries of Pathmark Stores, Inc. are not eligible.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>III.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PROGRAM DURATION</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Program will be offered on a voluntary basis from December 9, 2005 to January 23, 2006. If you wish to participate in the Program, we must receive your executed Retirement Agreement, Release and Waiver Form (the &#147;Release&#148;), as well as the remaining enclosed forms by <B>January 23, 2006</B>. If you elect to participate in the Program, you must retire no later than February 1, 2006. However, the Company reserves the right to delay any eligible associate&#146;s retirement for up to 90 days to accomplish business needs.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You are advised to consult with an attorney to review the Program and the Release before executing any forms. You should also consult with a tax specialist before making decisions about how your Pension Plan benefits will be paid and the tax withholding on monthly annuity payments.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Should you elect to participate in the Program, you have seven days after signing the Release to revoke your election (which would result in the forfeiture of all benefits under the Program). After this seven-day period, your election to retire under the Program is irrevocable. Therefore, you should carefully review the information in this booklet.</FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>IV.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PROGRAM BENEFITS</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you voluntarily elect to participate in the Program, your Pension Plan benefit will be enhanced in several respects:</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Your monthly benefit will be enhanced by adding the better of 3 years to your age or 3 years to your Credited Service (maximum Credited Service is 30 years).</FONT>
<BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>If you are under age 55 and satisfy the Rule of 70 (meaning your age and non-union Vesting Service when added together total at least 70), the reduction for early commencement will be 4% per year from age 65, instead of 4% from age 65 to age 55 and 6% thereafter. If you are under age 55, but don&#146;t satisfy the Rule of 70, the reduction per year will be 4% from age 65 to age 55 and 6% thereafter (instead of 6% for all years).</FONT><BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>You may elect to receive your entire enhanced Pension Plan benefit as a monthly annuity;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">or</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; you may elect that the portion attributable to your benefit enhancement (the portion of your benefit attributable to the addition of 3 years of age or 3 years of Credited Service) be paid in a lump sum, with the remainder paid as a monthly annuity;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">or</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; you may elect that 50% of your entire enhanced benefit be paid in a lump sum, with the remainder paid as a monthly annuity.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you are married, you will need the written, notarized consent of your spouse to elect any form of payment other than a joint and survivor annuity with your spouse as the beneficiary.</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>You will be entitled to a lump sum retirement bonus through the Pension Plan, ranging from 35% to 50% of your annual base pay rate as of December 1, 2005, depending on your length of continuous service since your most recent date of hire. This bonus may also be paid as a monthly annuity&#151;provided you elect to have your entire enhanced benefit paid as a monthly annuity.</FONT>
<BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>You may also opt to continue to participate in the active employee Medical and Prescription Plans through December 31, 2008 (or age 65, if earlier) on a contributory basis. You can then elect to extend this coverage for up to 18 months more by making COBRA (Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act) payments. However, continued participation in the active employee Medical and Prescription Plans (including COBRA continuation coverage) ends at age 65. (At age 65, a Medicare HMO program may be available.)</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Alternatively, you may elect a lump sum payment of $2,000 (payable from the Company vs. the Pension Plan) instead of continued medical and prescription coverage. <B>Note: You cannot elect this opt-out lump sum if you had previously opted out of medical coverage.</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The details of these enhancements are discussed below.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>AGE/CREDITED SERVICE ENHANCEMENT</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You will receive the greater of your benefit calculated by adding 3 years to your age or 3 years to your Credited Service as follows:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>3 years would be added to your age to determine the early retirement reduction applied to your benefit;</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>or</FONT>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>3 years of Credited Service would be added to your actual Credited Service used to calculate your benefit. However, not more than 30 years of Credited Service would be taken into account.</FONT></P></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The benefit formula and early retirement reduction under the Pension Plan are as follows:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>Benefit Formula</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The amount of your benefit payable at age 65 (or actual termination, if later) is equal to:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) 40% of your Average Final Compensation (the highest 5 years of pensionable compensation out of the last 10 years)</FONT></P>

<P STYLE='TEXT-INDENT: 7%'><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">minus</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) 50% of your Estimated Primary Social Security Benefit,</FONT></P>

<P STYLE='TEXT-INDENT: 7%'><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">multiplied by</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) the following fraction:</FONT></P>

<DIV STYLE='TEXT-INDENT: 4.5%'><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><u>your years of Credited Service (up to 30 years)</u></FONT></DIV>
<DIV STYLE='TEXT-INDENT: 18%'><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">30</FONT></DIV>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; However, your benefit payable at age 65 (or actual termination, if later) will not be less than the Minimum Benefit ($10.50 multiplied by your years of full-time Credited Service and/or $8.00 multiplied by your years of part-time Credited Service, with no more than 30 years of Credited Service taken into account).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B>Early Retirement Reduction</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you are (1) at least age 55 or (2) under age 55 but satisfy the Rule of 70 (meaning you have at least 10 years of non-union Vesting Service and the total of your age and years of Vesting Service equals at least 70), your monthly annuity benefit will be reduced by 4% for each year by which your benefit commencement date precedes age 65.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you are under age 55 and do not satisfy the Rule of 70, ordinarily your benefit would be reduced 6% per year for each year by which your benefit commencement date precedes age 65. However, if you retire under the Program, your benefit will be reduced by 4% per year from age 65 to age 55 and 6% for each year thereafter.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For more detailed information about how benefits are calculated under the Pension Plan, see the Pension Plan Summary Plan Description.</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><FONT SIZE="4">&bull;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT SIZE="2"><B>PENSION PLAN BENEFIT PAYMENT OPTIONS</B></FONT></FONT></P>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Pension Plan provides that payments be made in monthly benefit installments. The Program offers you the opportunity to elect, with spousal consent, to have:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><FONT SIZE="4">&bull;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT SIZE="2">the portion of your benefit attributable to your benefit enhancement (the increased amount payable due to the addition of 3 years of age or service as noted above) paid in a lump sum, with the remainder paid as a monthly annuity;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>or</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><FONT SIZE="4">&bull;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="2">50% of your entire benefit paid in a lump sum, with the remainder paid as a monthly annuity.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The lump sum is the single sum payment equal to the present value of your benefit enhancement or 50% of your entire benefit (as applicable) factoring in your age and certain actuarial assumptions. Once you receive a lump sum payment, no further payments from the Pension Plan, attributable to the monthly benefit the lump sum represents, are due you or your beneficiaries for any reason.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Alternatively, you may elect to receive your entire enhanced benefit as a monthly annuity.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you elect either of the lump sum options, you must also elect to receive your lump sum retirement bonus (described below) in a lump sum.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="4">&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>LUMP SUM RETIREMENT BONUS</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Once you elect to retire under this Program, you will also be eligible for the following retirement bonus&#151;based on your annual base pay rate as of December 1, 2005 and years of continuous service as shown below:</FONT></P>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

</CENTER>
</DIV>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Continuous service means the period of time (counted in years, months, and days) beginning with your most recent date of hire with the Company and ending on your retirement.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As discussed above, the Pension Plan provides that payments be made as a monthly annuity. The Program offers you the opportunity to elect, with spousal consent, to receive your retirement bonus in a lump sum payment. Alternatively, you can elect to have it paid as a monthly annuity&#151;provided you elect your entire enhanced benefit as a monthly annuity.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="4">&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>ENHANCED MEDICAL AND PRESCRIPTION PLAN COVERAGE</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You may also opt to continue to participate in the active employee Medical and Prescription Plans through December 31, 2008 (or age 65, if earlier) on a contributory basis. You can then elect to extend this coverage for up to 18 months more by making COBRA (Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act) payments. However, continued participation in the active employee Medical and Prescription Plans (including COBRA continuation coverage) ends at age 65. (At age 65, a Medicare HMO program may be available, depending on where you reside as a retiree.)</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Alternatively, you may elect a lump sum payment of $2,000 (payable from the Company vs. the Pension Plan) instead of continued medical and prescription coverage. <B>See note on page 5.</B></FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>V.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PAYMENT METHOD</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">To the extent permitted under Internal Revenue Service (IRS) rules, payments will be made from the Pension Plan by State Street Bank, the Pension Plan&#146;s Trustee. The portion of your benefit paid as a monthly annuity will commence shortly after February 1, 2006. Each month thereafter, your monthly annuity payment will arrive on or about the first of the month. The portion, if any, of your benefit paid in a lump sum will be mailed to you shortly after February 1, 2006.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following only applies to highly compensated employees, as defined by the IRS (those who earned over $95,000 in 2005):</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>IRS rules impact the amount of benefits that can be paid from qualified pension plans such as the Pension Plan through maximum benefit and compensation limitations and certain discrimination rules.</FONT>
<BR><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=4>&bull;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>If you are impacted, you will receive 2 Personalized Benefit Statements. One will reflect the qualified benefits paid from the Pension Plan. The other will state the non-qualified amounts paid by the Company.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any amounts that cannot be paid from the Pension Plan as a result of IRS rules will be paid by the Company in monthly installments only.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>VI.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TAXES</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Payments from the Pension Plan</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All amounts paid from the Pension Plan are taxed as ordinary income subject to Federal, State, and local income taxes.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Lump sum payments from the Pension Plan may be rolled over to an IRA or another employer&#146;s eligible retirement plan.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">If you elect a lump sum payment and are under age 55 in the year you retire, the lump sum payment may be subject to a 10% excise tax in addition to ordinary income taxes, unless the lump sum payment is rolled over to an IRA or another employer&#146;s plan. (Monthly benefit payments&#151;including the retirement bonus if paid on a monthly basis&#151;are not eligible for rollover, except in certain instances where the Social Security Level Income option is elected, and are not subject to the 10% excise tax).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><U>Payments from the Company</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As noted above, a portion of the Pension Plan benefit of certain higher paid employees may be paid by the Company rather than from the Pension Plan because of IRS limits. Any amounts paid from the Company are taxed as ordinary income subject to Federal, state, and local payroll taxes. Payments from the Company may not be rolled over to an IRA.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>VII.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TAX WITHHOLDING</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><U>Monthly Benefit Payments from the Pension Plan</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Federal law requires the Company to withhold taxes from your monthly benefit payments from the Pension Plan unless you instruct the Company not to make any withholding deductions.</FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You may elect to have or not to have withholding apply to your monthly benefit payments by completing the enclosed Form W-4P. This election covers only monthly benefit payments and the tax withholding is calculated using the withholding tables for monthly payments.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you elect not to have withholding apply or if you do not have enough Federal income tax withheld, you may be responsible for payment of estimated tax. You may incur penalties under the estimated tax rules if your withholding and estimated tax payments are not sufficient.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You may make or revoke elections for withholding from your monthly benefit payments at any time by completing another Form W-4P. Any election or revocation will be effective on the first of the month following 30 days notice.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><U>Lump Sum Payments from the Pension Plan</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Federal law requires that any lump sum payment from the Pension Plan be either (a) rolled over directly from the Pension Plan to your IRA or another employer&#146;s plan (if such plan accepts rollovers) or (b) paid directly to you with Federal income taxes withheld at a rate of 20%. Important information on this requirement is contained in the enclosed &#147;Special Tax Notice Regarding Payments from the Pension Plan.&#148; Please give us your decision on the enclosed &#147;Payment Instructions for Lump Sum Retirement Bonus/Lump Sum Payment of A Portion of Your Enhanced Monthly Benefits&#148; form.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><U>Payments from the Company</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any amounts paid by the Company will be in monthly installments only, taxed as ordinary income (Federal, state, and local payroll taxes will be withheld), and may not be rolled over to an IRA.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>VIII.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; OTHER IMPORTANT INFORMATION</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Should you elect to retire under the Program, you will be entitled to additional benefits as described below. Please note that specific plan provisions are contained in the applicable plan document(s) and the following is meant only to highlight them. The plans may be changed, altered, or terminated at the discretion of the Company.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>IX.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; CONTINUED BENEFITS COVERAGE</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><U>Medical and Prescription Coverages</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You can elect to continue to participate in the active employee Medical and Prescription Plans through December 31, 2008 (or until age 65, if earlier). The required contributions (expressed on a monthly basis) for this coverage will be:</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Single</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="20%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">$110.00</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Single + 1</FONT></TD>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">$180.00</FONT></TD>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Family</FONT></TD>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">$230.00</FONT></TD>
<TD><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">These contribution amounts will not change for the duration of the continuation period.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Alternatively, you may elect a lump sum payment of $2,000 (payable from the Company vs. the Pension Plan) instead of continued medical and prescription coverage. <B>See note on page 5</B>.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Following the completion of the continuation period, you can elect to extend your medical and prescription coverages for up to 18 months more by electing to make COBRA payments. This amounts to a maximum of almost 4&frac12; years of continued medical and prescription coverage.&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"> However, coverage under the Medical and Prescription Plans (including COBRA continuation coverage) cannot be continued after age 65. Also, your required contributions for COBRA coverage will be at the COBRA rates then in effect (rather than the above rates).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Coverage for your spouse under the Company&#146;s Medical and Prescription Plans also cannot be continued past age 65. Coverage for any dependent children can be continued for as long as you continue to have coverage, provided they also continue to qualify as eligible dependents under the Plans. Of course, continued coverage for you, your spouse, and any eligible dependent children is subject to the timely payment of your required contributions.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">While Pathmark medical and prescription coverage ceases once you and/or your spouse reach age 65, you and/or your spouse may have the opportunity to participate in a group sponsored Medicare HMO program offered by Aetna Inc.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">The availability, pricing, and design of group sponsored Medicare HMO coverage depends on where you will reside as a retiree. Aetna will bill you on a quarterly basis for the Medicare HMO premium, which is subject to change on an annual basis.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">A decision to decline group sponsored Medicare HMO coverage or to subsequently discontinue coverage is irrevocable. Should you (or in the event of your death, your spouse) fail to make the required quarterly contributions on a timely basis, group sponsored Medicare HMO coverage will be terminated and cannot be re-elected.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Once you become Medicare eligible you will also be entitled to elect prescription plan coverage under the new Medicare Part D program.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B><U>Other Coverages</U></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With the exception of Medical and Prescription Plan coverage noted above, all current, active benefit plan coverage will cease effective with your retirement.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dental, vision, and/or Health Care Spending Account coverages are available (provided you are currently participating) for up to 18 months under the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA). You and/or your family may elect to continue any or all of these coverages on a fully contributory basis (including a 2% administrative surcharge) as of your retirement&#151;to assure uninterrupted coverage.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Your COBRA package, describing your COBRA related options in detail, will be mailed to you by BCI, Pathmark&#146;s COBRA Administrator.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>X.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PSI SAVINGS PLAN</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you retire, you will be entitled to receive a complete lump sum distribution of your vested Account balance under the Savings Plan. Distributions are generally made approximately 30 days following your retirement. However, if you are under age 70 and your vested Account balance exceeds $1,000, you have the right to defer your distribution until any later date up to age 70.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Distributions are not processed for 30 days following retirement as reported on the payroll system to allow any remaining contribution activity to be reflected in your Account. Distribution is made in a lump sum and reflects the Account value on the payment Valuation Date.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you defer distribution of your Account, you can continue to direct the investment of your Account under the same rules applicable to active employees until your distribution is made.</FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Federal law requires that the taxable portion of your distribution be either (a) rolled over directly from the Savings Plan to your IRA or another employer&#146;s plan (if such plan accepts rollovers) or (b) paid directly to you with Federal income taxes withheld at a rate of 20%. The actual taxes due could be more or less than 20% depending on your personal tax situation. Further, if you receive a distribution of your Account Balance before age 55 and do not roll it over to an IRA you may incur a 10% excise tax on your distribution in addition to ordinary income tax. Important information on these requirements may be obtained by contacting Fidelity at 1-800-835-5095.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment instructions for distributions can be made by also calling Fidelity<I> </I>at 1-800-835-5095.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><I>The Company reserves the right to at any time end any of the Plans or modify, suspend, amend or change, the provisions, terms and conditions of the Plans or related policies and procedures for retirees without notice or approval from anyone.</I></B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>IF YOU WISH TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM,<br>PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS ON PAGES 12 &amp; 13</B></FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>3. CONTINUED BENEFITS COVERAGE</B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="4">&bull;<B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>Medical and Prescription Plan Coverage</B></FONT>
</P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Opt to continue medical and prescription coverage or elect to receive $2,000 for opting out of coverage.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____ Complete Application for Continued Benefits Coverage/Coverage Opt Out (<B>page 21</B>)</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Forms to elect to continue dental, vision, and/or Health Care Spending Account coverage available under COBRA will be mailed to your home address by the Company&#146;s COBRA Administrator, BCI.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Forms to elect to continue medical and prescription coverage available under COBRA following the completion of the 3-year continuation period will be mailed to your home address by the Company&#146;s COBRA Administrator, BCI.</FONT></P>

ENTIRE BENEFIT AMOUNT IN A MONTHLY ANNUITY </B>(</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PT DOUBLE"><B>Check only one of the four options below</B></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">)</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] <B>LIFE ANNUITY</B>: Benefits payable to me for my lifetime with all payments ceasing at my death.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] <B>JOINT AND SURVIVOR ANNUITY</B>: Benefits payable for my lifetime and, upon my death, payments will continue to my Joint Annuitant in the following percentage for the remainder of his or her life.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Percent to Joint Annuitant (check one)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] 100%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] 66-2/3%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] 50%</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;]<B> PERIOD CERTAIN AND LIFE ANNUITY</B>: Benefits payable for my lifetime and, upon my death, payments will continue to my Joint Annuitant for the remainder of the elected period certain.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Option Periods (check one)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] 60 months&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;] 120 months</FONT><BR>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>A<SMALL>PPLICATION</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> P<SMALL>ROGRAM</SMALL> B<SMALL>ENEFITS</SMALL> (C<SMALL>ONT</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>D</SMALL>)</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>SPOUSE&#146;S ACKNOWLEDGMENT AND CONSENT TO ELECTION OF BENEFITS PAYABLE IN ANY FORM OTHER THAN JOINT AND SURVIVOR ANNUITY FORM WITH SPOUSE AS SURVIVOR ANNUITANT</B></FONT></P>

<DIV><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">R<SMALL>ETIREE</SMALL> N<SMALL>AME</SMALL>___________________________________ &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;S.S.#
_________________________</FONT></DIV>
<DIV STYLE='TEXT-INDENT:18%'><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">(P<SMALL>LEASE</SMALL> P<SMALL>RINT</SMALL>)</FONT></DIV>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">I, _______________________________________, the spouse of the above named participant in the PSI Pension Plan, hereby</FONT>
<BR>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">(S<SMALL>POUSE</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>s</SMALL> N<SMALL>AME</SMALL>&#151;P<SMALL>LEASE</SMALL> P<SMALL>RINT</SMALL>)</FONT><BR>
<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">acknowledge that I have read and understand my spouse&#146;s election with regard to form(s) of benefit payments. I hereby consent to the form(s) of payment elected by my spouse (including any beneficiary designation). I understand that the entire benefit payable to my spouse from the PSI Pension Plan would otherwise be payable in the form of a Joint and Survivor Annuity under which I would be entitled to a monthly benefit for my life should my spouse die before me. I acknowledge that as a result of my consent, my spouse&#146;s benefit will instead be paid in the form(
s) elected by my spouse.</FONT></P>

<BR>
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TD WIDTH=28% ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>______________________________________<BR>SIGNATURE OF SPOUSE</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=1% ALIGN=LEFT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____________________________________</FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">NOTARY PUBLIC</FONT></P>

<P align=center style="page-break-after:always"></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>PSI PENSION PLAN</B></FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><B>PRIMARY SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFIT</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">N<SMALL>AME</SMALL>____________________________________&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;S.S.# _________________________</FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">(P<SMALL>LEASE</SMALL> P<SMALL>RINT</SMALL>)</FONT></P>

<BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE>
<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Your Primary Social Security Benefit used to calculate the benefit offset under the Pension Plan is the estimated Social Security old age insurance benefit payable to you at age 65 (or actual retirement, if later) under the law in effect when you retire or terminate employment. In determining this amount your wage history is determined by reference to tables which assume annual percentage changes in salary equal to those experienced nationally. If you participated in the SGC Profit Sharing Plan at any time between 1967 through 1972, your Primary Social Security Benefit will be computed assuming you had no earnings subject to Social Security taxes during any of the calendar year(s) from 1967 through 1972 in which you participated in the SGC Profit Sharing Plan. Under the Plan&#146;s tables, the estimated Primary Social Security Benefit used to calculate your Pension Plan benefit is $_________ per month payable at age 65 (or actual retirement, if later).
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">You have the right, however, to have your Primary Social Security Benefit recomputed for Plan purposes on the basis of your actual Social Security earnings history. This may result in a greater Pension Plan benefit. If you wish to do so, you must return this form to the Pension Department <U>within 30 days</U> indicating that you will be supplying your actual year-by-year Social Security earnings history and then you must obtain your actual earnings history from the Social Security Administration and provide it to the Pension Department <B>not later than June 9, 2006.</B> If you do not do so, you will forfeit the right to provide your actual Social Security earnings history and your Primary Social Security Benefit will be calculated for purposes of your Pension Plan benefit using the Plan&#146;s tables described above.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">The calculation of your Primary Social Security Benefit is solely for purposes of determining your benefit under the Pension Plan. It does not affect your actual Social Security benefit.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2"><U>Election</U>:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">I elect to have my Primary Social Security Benefit for purposes of determining my Pension Plan benefit calculated using<BR>(</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PT DOUBLE"><B>Check one</B></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">):</FONT></P>
</BLOCKQUOTE>

<BR>
<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">__________ PLAN&#146;S TABLES&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; __________ SOCIAL SECURITY EARNINGS HISTORY</FONT></P>

<BR>
<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">SIGNATURE _________________________________ Date ______________________</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">I have read and understand the attached <B>SPECIAL TAX NOTICE REGARDING PAYMENTS FROM THE PSI PENSION PLAN</B>. I understand that my return of this form constitutes a waiver of any unused portion of the 30-day period available to me for considering my payment options.</FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">(</FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PT DOUBLE"><B>Complete Section A or B below</B></FONT>)<FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____ 1. I hereby elect a direct rollover of ALL of the lump sum retirement bonus/lump sum payment of a portion of my enhanced monthly benefit which qualifies as an eligible rollover distribution to the traditional individual retirement account or annuity (&#147;IRA&#148;) or employer plan I have specified in A.3. below.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____ 2. I hereby authorize Direct Rollover of $ _________ of the lump sum retirement bonus/lump sum payment of a portion of my enhanced monthly benefit which qualifies as an eligible rollover distribution, with the remainder of my eligible rollover distribution paid directly to me. I understand that the portion paid to me will be subject to 20% mandatory federal income tax withholding and may be subject to a 10% penalty tax.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____ 3. The Direct Rollover will be made payable to:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">______ Traditional IRA <B>or</B> _____ Eligible Employer Plan</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">_____________________________________________________</FONT><BR><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">Name of Institution/Retirement Plan/Account #, if applicable</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;_____ <B>LUMP SUM RETIREMENT BONUS/LUMP SUM PAYMENT OF A PORTION OF MY ENHANCED MONTHLY BENEFIT PAID TO ME DIRECTLY SUBJECT TO 20% WITHHOLDING&#151;</B>I hereby elect to have the entire amount of my eligible rollover distribution paid directly to me. I understand that this amount will be subject to 20% mandatory Federal income tax withholding and may be subject to a 10% penalty tax.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT face="Times New Roman" size="2">I understand that if I return this form without providing the Pathmark Pension Department my actual earnings history, I am waiving my right to have my Plan benefit calculated using my actual Social Security earnings history.</FONT></P>

<TITLE>Exhibit 10.46</TITLE>
