<BODY>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.46</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>TRANSITION
AGREEMENT</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">THIS TRANSITION AGREEMENT, dated March 27, 2006,
(the&#160;&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), by and between Pathmark Stores, Inc., a Delaware corporation
(the&#160;&#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;) and Harvey M. Gutman (the&#160;&#147;<U>Executive</U>&#148;).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, the Company and the Executive are parties to a
certain Employment Agreement, dated as of February 1, 1999, as amended by the First Amendment to Employment
Agreement dated April 15, 1999, and by the Side Letter to the Sale and Retention Bonus Agreement, the
Employment Agreement and Certain Additional Understandings dated July 1, 2000 (the&#160;&#147;<U>Employment
Agreement</U>&#148;);</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, the Executive has elected to retire from the
employ of the Company in accordance with the Pathmark Stores, Inc. Retirement Incentive Program offering
December 9, 2005 to January 23, 2006 (the &#147;Program&#148;, a copy of which is attached hereto as Schedule
A);</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Executive has executed
the waiver and release of claims attached to the Program (the &#147;Release&#148;);</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, the Executive
has agreed, at the request of the Company, to remain in his current position
actively employed with the Company until April 8, 2006 (the &#147;Retirement
Date&#148;).</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">NOW, THEREFORE, in
consideration of the covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth in this
Agreement, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">1.  <U>Retirement</U>.  The
Executive  has  elected  to retire  pursuant  to the  Program,  effective  as of the
Retirement  Date.  Executive  agrees to remain  actively  employed with the Company until
the Retirement  Date.  The Employment Agreement shall terminate on the Retirement Date.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">2.  Salary and Bonus.  In
consideration  of the covenants  set forth herein and the Release,  the Company  shall
provide the Executive the following:</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(a)  <U>Salary</U>.
The Company  shall  continue  to pay  Executive  at his  current  weekly rate of pay
through the Retirement Date in accordance with the Employment Agreement.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(b)  <U>Treatment
of Equity-Based Compensation.</U></FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(i)
The  Stock Options previously awarded to Executive under the 2000 Employee Equity  Plan
(together with the individual award agreements applicable to  Executive&#146;s awards,
(the &#147;<U>Equity </U> <U>Plan</U>&#148;)), as  listed on Schedule B hereto (the &#147;<U>Stock
Options</U>), which vested prior  to the date hereof, shall remain exercisable in
accordance with the terms of the  Equity Plan until the second anniversary of the
Retirement Date.</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(ii)
Stock Options granted on June 9, 2005 (the &#147;<U>June Grant</U>&#148;), as  listed on
Schedule B, will be treated as follows:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">If
Executive  remains actively employed through the Retirement Date, 50% of the June Grant
will vest on  June 9, 2006 and the remainder of the June Grant will be forfeited
immediately. The June  Grant (to the extent vested) shall remain exercisable in
accordance with the terms of the  Equity Plan until the second anniversary of the
Retirement Date.</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(iii)
In the event of any merger, sale or consolidation of the Company or other  transaction
affecting the Company&#146;s Common Stock, the Compensation  Committee of the Company&#146;s
Board of Directors, in its sole discretion and  without Executive&#146;s consent, may
provide for:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(A)
the  continuation  of the Stock  Options by the  Company (if the Company is  the
surviving corporation);</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(B)
the assumption of the Stock Options by the surviving corporation; and</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(C)
the substitution by the surviving corporation of stock option(s) with  substantially the
same terms for the outstanding Stock Options; or the  cancellation of the Stock Options
upon payment to Executive of a per share  amount in cash or cash equivalents equal to (A)&#160;the
highest price paid for  a share of the Company&#146;s Common Stock in such merger, sale,
consolidation  or other transaction, minus (B)&#160;the exercise price of the applicable
Stock  Option.</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(iv)
Restricted Stock Units (&#147;<U>Stock Awards</U>&#148;) granted on June 9,  2005, as
listed on Schedule B, will be treated as follows:</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">If
Executive  remains actively employed through the Retirement Date, 50% of the Stock Awards
will vest  on June 9, 2006 and the remainder will be forfeited immediately.</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%"><P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(v)
Stock Awards shall be settled in accordance with the terms and provisions of the  Equity
Plan.</FONT></P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(c)
<U>Pension/401(k) Plan</U>. The Executive&#146;s participation in the
Company&#146;s Savings Plan, Pension Plan and Excess Benefit Plan and the
Supplemental Retirement Agreement, dated as of June 1, 1994, as amended by
Amendment No. 1, between the Company and the Executive (collectively
the&#160;&#147;<U>Retirement Plans</U>&#148;) shall terminate on the Retirement
Date. The Executive&#146;s rights and obligations under the Retirement Plans
shall be governed by applicable law and the terms and conditions of the
Retirement Plans, as the same may be amended as provided in Section 5(c) hereof.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(d)
<U>Bonus</U>. In the event the Company implements a quarterly bonus plan for
2006, Executive will participate as a Senior Vice President in said plan with
respect to the first quarter of 2006 if Executive remains actively employed
through the Retirement Date.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(e)
<U>Accrued Vacation</U>. The Executive shall continue to accrue vacation through
the Retirement Date in accordance with Company policy. Unused vacation at the
Retirement Date will be paid to Executive promptly thereafter.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(f)
<U>No Other Compensation or Benefits</U>. The Executive shall not be entitled to
any compensation or benefits or to participate in any past, present or future
employee benefit programs or arrangements of the Company (including, without
limitation, any compensation or benefits under any severance plan, program or
arrangement) on or after the Retirement Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the
Executive shall be entitled to the payments and benefits included in the
Program.</FONT></P>


<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>


<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">3. <U>Return of
Property</U>. On or prior to the Retirement Date, the Executive (except as
otherwise provided in the Consulting Agreement, as hereinafter defined) will
surrender to the Company all property of the Company in the Executive&#146;s
possession and all property made available to the Executive in connection with
his employment by the Company, including, without limitation, the Company car,
any and all Company access and credit cards, keys, records, manuals, customer
lists, notebooks, telephones and other hand-held devices, computers, computer
programs and files, papers, electronically stored information and documents kept
or made by the Executive in connection with his employment. The Executive shall
delete all electronically stored information and documents relating to the
Company kept or made by the Executive in connection with his employment that
were stored on his personal computer and laptop.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">4. <U>Cooperation</U>.
From and after the date hereof until the first anniversary of the termination or
expiration of the Consulting Agreement (as hereinafter defined), the Executive
shall cooperate in all reasonable respects with the Company and its respective
directors, officers, attorneys and experts in connection with the conduct of any
action, proceeding, investigation or litigation involving the Company, including
any such action, proceeding, investigation or litigation in which the Executive
is called to testify. The Company agrees to reimburse the Executive for all
reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred by the Executive in connection with
such cooperation.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">5.  <U>Miscellaneous</U>.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(a)
<U>Entire Agreement</U>. Except as set forth in the last sentence of this
Subsection (a) of Section 5, this Agreement and the Release set forth the entire
agreement and understanding of the parties hereto with respect to the matters
covered hereby and supersedes and replaces any express or implied, written or
oral, prior agreement, plan or arrangement with respect to the terms of the
Executive&#146;s employment and the termination thereof which the Executive may
have had with the Company including the Employment Agreement, but excluding the
Program, the Retirement Plans and, with respect to the awards listed on Schedule
B, the Equity Plan. This Agreement may be amended only by a written document
signed by the parties hereto.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(b)
<U>Withholding Taxes</U>. Any payments made or benefits provided to the
Executive under this Agreement shall be reduced by the lowest applicable
withholding taxes.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(c)
<U>Section 409A</U>. If any provision of this Agreement contravenes Section 409A
of the Code, the regulations promulgated thereunder or any related guidance
issued by the U.S. Treasury Department, this Agreement shall be reformed to
maintain to the maximum extent practicable the original intent of the provision
without violating the requirements of Section 409A of the Code. In addition, if
the Company shall, with respect to any other employee of the Company, amend any
nonqualified deferred compensation plan (as defined in Section 409A(d) of the
Code) to comply with or to conform to the provisions of Section 409A of the
Code, the Company shall similarly amend any comparable such plan with respect to
the Executive.</FONT></P>


<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>


<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(d)
<U>Governing Law</U>. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in
accordance with, the laws of the State of New Jersey.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(e)
<U>Waiver</U>. The failure of any party to this Agreement to enforce any of its
terms, provisions or covenants shall not be construed as a waiver of the same or
of the right of such party to enforce the same. Waiver by any party hereto of
any breach or default by another party of any term or provision of this
Agreement shall not operate as a waiver of any other breach or default.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(f)
<U>Severability</U>. In the event that any one or more of the provisions of this
Agreement shall be held to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable, the validity,
legality and enforceability of the remainder of the Agreement shall not in any
way be affected or impaired thereby. Moreover, if any one or more of the
provisions contained in this Agreement shall be held to be excessively broad as
to duration, activity or subject, such provisions shall be construed by limiting
and reducing them so as to be enforceable to the maximum extent allowed by
applicable law.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(g)
<U>Notices</U>. Any notices required or made pursuant to this Agreement shall be
in writing and shall be deemed to have been given when delivered by hand, sent
by telecopier or mailed by United States registered mail, return receipt
requested, postage prepaid, addressed to General Counsel, Pathmark Stores, Inc.,
200 Milik Street, Carteret, New Jersey 07008, telecopier: (732) 499-6891, or to
the Executive at his current address on the books and records of the Company, or
to such other address as either party may furnish to the other in writing in
accordance with this Section 5(g). Notices of change of address shall be
effective only upon receipt.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(h)
<U>Descriptive Headings</U>. The paragraph headings contained herein are for
reference purposes only and shall not in any way affect the meaning or
interpretation of this Agreement.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(i)  <U>Counterparts</U>.
This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts,  which,  together,  shall
constitute one and the same agreement.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">(j)
<U>Successors and Assigns</U>. Except as otherwise provided herein, this
Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon and enforceable by
and against the Executive and the Company and their respective successors and
assigns (and in the event of the Executive&#146;s death, the Executive&#146;s
heirs). The Company will require any successor (whether direct or indirect , by
purchase, merger, consolidation or otherwise) to all or substantially all of the
business or assets of the Company expressly to assume and to agree to perform
this Agreement in the same manner and to the same extent that the Company would
be required to perform it if no such succession had taken place; <I>provided,
however</I>, that no such assumption shall relieve the Company of its
obligations hereunder.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">6.  <U>Consulting Agreement</U>.
The Company and Executive agree to execute a Consulting Agreement in  substantially the
form of agreement attached hereto as Schedule C (the &quot;Consulting Agreement&quot;),
effective as  of April 10, 2006.</FONT></P>



<P style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p>


<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the
Company has executed this Agreement as of the date first set forth above and the
Executive has executed this Agreement as of the date set forth below (or, if the
Executive does not include a date under the Executive&#146;s signature line, the
date set forth shall be the date this Agreement, signed by the Executive, is
received by the Company).</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">PATHMARK STORES, INC.</FONT><BR>&nbsp;</TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
     <TD WIDTH="30%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD WIDTH="20%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD WIDTH="40%">
     <FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">By: <U>/s/ Frank G. Vitrano</U></FONT></TD>
     <TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">Name: Frank G. Vitrano<BR>Title: President and Chief Financial Officer</FONT></TD>
     <TD><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>THE EXECUTIVE HEREBY
ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE EXECUTIVE HAS READ THIS AGREEMENT, THAT THE EXECUTIVE
FULLY KNOWS, UNDERSTANDS AND APPRECIATES ITS CONTENTS, AND THAT THE EXECUTIVE
HEREBY ENTERS INTO THIS AGREEMENT VOLUNTARILY AND OF HIS OWN FREE WILL.</B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">ACCEPTED AND AGREED:</FONT></P>

<P><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><U>/s/ Harvey M. Gutman</U><BR>
Harvey M. Gutman<BR>

Date: March 27, 2006</FONT></P>

<HEAD>
     <TITLE>Exhibit 21.1</TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 21.1</B></FONT></P>

<H4 align="center">Pathmark Stores, Inc.<BR>List of Subsidiaries<BR>January 28, 2006</H4>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="60%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR style="font-size: 10pt" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
     <TH ALIGN="LEFT"><U>Name</U> </TH>
     <TH colspan="3">State of<BR><U>Incorporation</U></TH></TR>
<TR><TD>&nbsp;</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 10pt" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
     <TD WIDTH="82%" ALIGN="LEFT">Adbrett Corp</TD>
     <TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="LEFT">&nbsp;</TD>
     <TD WIDTH="4%" ALIGN="LEFT" NOWRAP>Delaware</TD>
     <TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="LEFT">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

by reference in  Registration  Statement  No.  333-46882 on Form S-1 and  333-129083, 333-131522, 333-131523
and 333-62008 on Form S-8 of our report dated April 7, 2006,  relating to the
consolidated  financial  statements of Pathmark  Stores,  Inc., and  management&#146;s  report
on the  effectiveness of internal control over  financial  reporting  appearing in and
incorporated by reference in the Annual Report on Form 10-K of Pathmark  Stores, Inc. for
the fiscal year ended January 28, 2006.</FONT></P>

<TYPE>EX-24.1
<SEQUENCE>14
<FILENAME>ex24-1.htm
<TEXT>
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2 Final//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
     <TITLE>Exhibit 24.1</TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 24.1</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Pathmark Stores,
Inc.</B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2"><B>Power of Attorney</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">The
undersigned, a director of Pathmark Stores, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), a Delaware corporation, which
intends to file with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission, under the provisions of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#147;'34 Act&#148;), as amended, each year an Annual Report on Form
10-K, or such other form appropriate for the purpose, pursuant to Section 13 or 15(d) of the '34 Act, together
with possible amendments thereto, constitutes and appoints <B><I>John T. Standley, Frank G. Vitrano</I></B> and <B><I>Marc A.
Strassler</I></B>, and each of them, severally, as true and lawful attorney or attorneys, with full power of
substitution and resubstitution, for him and in his name, place and stead, to sign in any and all capacities
and file or cause to be filed said Annual Report on Form 10-K, and any and all amendments thereto, and all
instruments necessary or incidental in connection therewith, and hereby grants to the said attorneys, and each
of them, severally, full power and authority to do and perform in the name and on behalf of the undersigned,
and in any and all capacities, any and all acts and things whatsoever necessary or appropriate to be done in
the premises, as fully and to all intents and purposes as the undersigned might or could do in person, hereby
ratifying and confirming the acts of said attorneys and each of them.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS
WHEREOF, the undersigned has hereunto set his hand and seal this 4th day of April, 2006.</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
     <TD WIDTH="30%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman, Times, Serif" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>20
<FILENAME>ex31-1.htm
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<title>Pathmark Stores, Inc. Form 10-K; For the Fiscal Year Ended January 28, 2006; Exhibit 31.1</title>
</HEAD>
<!-- Production by ELECTRONIC PUBLISHING SERVICES (www.epubsinc.com) -->
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>

<font size=2>

<BR>
<p align=right><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.1 </B></P>


<H3 align="center">Form of CEO Certification</H3>

<P>I, John T. Standley, certify that:</P>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">1. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> I
have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Pathmark Stores, Inc.;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">2. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> Based
on my  knowledge,  this report does not contain  any untrue  statement  of a material
fact or omit to  state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of
the circumstances  under which such  statements were made, not misleading with respect to
the period covered by this report;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">3. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> Based
on my knowledge,  the financial  statements and other financial  information  included in
this report,  fairly  present in all material  respects the financial  condition,
results of operations and cash flows of  the registrant as of, and for, the periods
presented in this report;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">4. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> The
registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and
maintaining  disclosure  controls and  procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
13a-15(e) and  15d-15(e))  and internal  control  over financial  reporting (as defined
in Exchange Act Rules  13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and  have:</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>a. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> designed
such disclosure controls and procedures,  or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures  to be  designed  under  our  supervision,  to  ensure  that  material
information  relating  to the  registrant,  including  its  consolidated  subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those  entities, particularly during the period in
which this report is being prepared;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>b. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> designed
such  internal  control over  financial  reporting,  or caused such  internal  control
over  financial reporting to be designed under our supervision,  to provide reasonable
assurance regarding  the  reliability of financial  reporting and the  preparation  of
financial  statements for external  purposes in accordance with generally accepted
accounting principles;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>c. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s  disclosure controls and procedures and
presented in  this report our conclusions  about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures,  as  of the end of the period covered by this report based on
such evaluation; and</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>d. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s  internal  control over financial
reporting  that occurred  during the  registrant&#146;s  fourth fiscal quarter that has
materially  affected,  or is  reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting;  and</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">5. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> The
registrant&#146;s  other  certifying  officer and I have disclosed,  based on our most
recent  evaluation of  internal  control over financial  reporting,  to the  registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit  committee of the  registrant&#146;s board of directors (or
persons performing the equivalent functions):</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>a. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> all
significant  deficiencies  and  material  weaknesses  in the design or  operation  of
internal  controls over financial  reporting which are reasonably  likely to adversely
affect the registrant&#146;s  ability to record, process, summarize and report financial
information; and</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>b. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> any
fraud,  whether  or not  material,  that  involves  management  or other  employees  who
have a  significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting.</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><I>Date:</I>  April 7, 2006</P>

<P><B>/s/ John T. Standley</B><HR align=left NOSHADE size=1 width=150 color=black><B>John T. Standley</B><BR>
<I>Chief Executive Officer</I></P>

<P>
<HR width=100 color=black size=1 align=left noshade>
* Required pursuant to Rules 13a-14(a) and 15d-14(a) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.</p>

<H3 align="center">Form of CEO Certification</H3>

<P>I, Frank G. Vitrano, certify that:</P>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">

have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Pathmark Stores, Inc.;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">2. </TD>
<TD WIDTH=95% align="left"> Based
on my  knowledge,  this report does not contain  any untrue  statement  of a material
fact or omit to  state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of
the circumstances  under which such  statements were made, not misleading with respect to
the period covered by this report;</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align="left">3. </TD>

on my knowledge,  the financial  statements and other financial  information  included in
this report,  fairly  present in all material  respects the financial  condition,
results of operations and cash flows of  the registrant as of, and for, the periods
presented in this report;</TD>
</TR>

in Exchange Act Rules  13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and  have:</TD>

</TR>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">

<H4 align="center">Certification Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350,<BR>

As Adopted Pursuant to<BR>

Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</H4>

<HR width=100% size=1 noshade align="left">



<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection  with the annual  report of Pathmark
Stores,  Inc.  (the  &#147;Company&#148;)  on Form 10-K for the fiscal year  ended
January  28, 2006, as filed with the Securities  and Exchange  Commission on the date
hereof (the  &#147;Report&#148;),  I, John  T.  Standley,  Chief  Executive  Officer of
the Company,  hereby certify,  pursuant to 18  U.S.C.  Section 1350, as adopted  pursuant
to Section 906  of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of  2002, that, to the best of my knowledge:</P>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>(1) </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> the
Report  fully  complies  with the  requirements  of Section  13(a) or 15(d) of the
Securities  Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left></TD>
<TD WIDTH=5% align=left>(2) </TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% ALIGN=left> the
information  contained  in the  Report  fairly  represents,  in all  material  respects,
the  financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A  signed  original  of  this  written  statement
required  by  Section  906,  or  other  document  authenticating,  acknowledging,  or
otherwise  adopting the  signature  that appears in typed form within the  electronic
version of this  written  statement  required  by Section  906,  has been  provided to
the Company and will be retained by the Company and  furnished to the Securities and
Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.</P>

<H4 align="center">Certification Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350,<BR>

Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended  January 28, 2006,
as filed with the Securities and Exchange  Commission on the date hereof (the  &#147;Report&#148;),
I, Frank  G. Vitrano,  Chief Financial Officer of the Company,  hereby certify,  pursuant
to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted  pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act
of 2002, that, to the best of my knowledge:</P>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>

</TR>
</TABLE>

<P><TABLE style="font-size:10pt" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">

the  financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</TD>
